issue.title: [Java] Improve the performance of RangeEqualVisitor for comparing variable-width vectors
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6221](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6221). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Two improvements:
1. Compare the whole range of the data buffer, instead of comparing individual elements.
1. If two elements are of different sizes, there is no need to compare them.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6221?focusedCommentId=16921155) by Liya Fan (fan_li_ya):*
According to the discussion in https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8de66a11b0256d2c81aa767f9ad3b4501829707bf16fb80bbb927f72@%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E
The code in the PR is not applicable. So we close it.
